name: Super Mario Bros (Itizso)
description:
Playable 3D simulation of this   classic handheld electronic game including views of the original packaging and instruction guide . A RetroFab simulation Version 0.9.5 (beta) Details Title Super Mario Bros. Model No. YM-801 Series Game & Watch ( Crystal Screen ) Manufacturer Nintendo Release Date June 25, 1986 Chipset Sharp SM511 ( 32.768 kHz ) Description

Super Mario Bros. was the first title released by Nintendo in the Crystal Screen format of the Game & Watch series of handheld LCD games featuring a transparent see-thru screen and innovative side-scrolling gameplay.

Gameplay

Bowser and his Koopas (a tribe of turtles) have invaded the Mushroom Kingdom and kidnapped Princess Toadstool! To free the captured princess Mario must set out on a quest to rescue her by passing through 8 unique worlds:

  • World No. 1 - Canyon
    Leap between platforms to avoid falling into the canyon below.
     
  • World No. 2 - Gym
    Skip over obstacles and avoid being squashed by the walls.
     
  • World No. 3 - Burning Room
    A non-scrolling world where Mario must avoid the spinning flames in a timed challenge.
     
  • World No. 4 - Channel
    Mario must swim under water while avoiding the floating bars.
     
  • World No. 5 - Hop
    Leap between platforms while jumping over walls.
     
  • World No. 6 - Beam
    Another non-scrolling world where Mario must leap between moving beams in a timed challenge.
     
  • World No. 7 - Maze
    Carefully pick the right route through the maze.
     
  • World No. 8 - Burning Road
    Avoid the burning flames that lie on the road that leads to the princess

At the end of each world an illusion of the princess will appear to guide Mario to the next world. When all 8 Worlds are completed, the game loops and the next 8 Worlds await with event more challenges including enemies (Lakitu and Bullet Bill) that will try to stop Mario.

Controls Keyboard Up W or Up Arrow Down S or Down Arrow Left A or Left Arrow Right D or Right Arrow Jump Ctrl or Enter Mouse Rotate Drag Press Left-click Zoom Mousewheel Resources Audio David Haywood ( youtube.com ) Box Art Nintandbox ( nintandbox.net ) Instructions Torsten Lindh ( intheattic.co.uk ) Textures Lee Robson ( progettosnaps.net )
